page.title: 11Recreation Facilities.
page.content: Although there is no football ground for spectating in the square, there is a training ground for Crystal Palace Football Club. There is a running track at Tweeddale Road which was opened in 1958 by the Duke of Edinburgh.A world class athlete, Gordon Pirie,was the first person to run on it.Many local schools use the track and the other facilities for athletics training and meetings. For those who like to go at a slower pace, there are numerous parks where people can stroll and young children amuse themselves e.g. Poulter's Park, Ravensbury Park and Morden Park where there is also a small golf course. Middleton Circle Library can supply tapes, posters, cassettes, pictures, records as well as books!There is also a computer to play on during the school holidays.
